text.p: Swissair is considering the launch of a three times weekly full-freighter service between Geneva and Singapore at the end of next month using a 65-tonne capacity McDonnell Douglas DC10-30F aircraft, industry sources said.
"We'd rather not say too much at this stage about our plans as they are not yet finalised," a Swissair cargo official told Reuters from Zurich.
The DC10-30F would be the same as that used on Swissair's recently launched weekly freighter service between Basle and Sao Paulo and also on it weekly Basle-Chicago route, the official said.
The aircraft is wet-leased from Gemini Air Cargo.

Cargo bound for Singapore is currently shipped on Swissair's daily MD11 passenger service from Zurich which can carry 20 to 25 tonnes of freight per flight. --Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 8982 Fax +44 171 542 5017
